meanings.definition: To forcibly put an end to something
meanings.sent1: The police officer suppresses the riot quickly.
meanings.sent2: The medication suppresses the pain effectively.
meanings.sent3: The magician suppresses the rabbit back into the hat.
meanings.sent4: The teacher suppresses the noise in the classroom like a volume knob.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter suppresses the flames with a powerful hose.

meanings.definition: To prevent the development, action, or expression of something
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy can suppresses the growth of harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent2: The strict rules suppresses any form of creativity.
meanings.sent3: The rainy weather suppresses our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The locked door suppresses our ability to enter the room.
meanings.sent5: The loud music suppresses our ability to concentrate.

meanings.definition: To keep something from being revealed or made public
meanings.sent1: The spy suppresses sensitive information to protect national security.
meanings.sent2: The company suppresses the negative reviews to maintain a positive image.
meanings.sent3: The diary suppresses the secrets of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The password suppresses unauthorized access to the system.
meanings.sent5: The confidentiality agreement suppresses the disclosure of classified data.
